page.title: 02Brodsworth C.ofE. F/M School
page.content: Our{school}has thirty four{pupils}on roll, two and a half{teachers,}one part time N.T.A.,two dinner ladies ,a secretary for two afternoons per week and a cleaner.The children are from 4+ to12+ when they go to Adwick{School. The{school}is over a hundred years old and apart from a mobile are built of stone.The middle of the{school}used to be the headtecher's house.Upstairs there is a bathroom and two bedrooms. The staircaise is very steep and narrow.In the village of Brodsworth there has been organised{education since the 17th. century.The{school}is owned by Mrs Grant-Dalton and rented to the local authority for a token rent.In 1981 the school was saved from closure by a vigourous campaign by parents and friends.We, like other schools have falling rolls which we notice more in a small school.
